column5: It is truly a sad day when the young ones you watched grow up die before you. As a scout master I was privileged in knowing many a fine young child. Some being more like sons rather than someone elses kids. Not all angels, but each was special. Regretably, I was give the news that one of these boys had been murdered in Hamilton. Such a terrible waste.
What a terrible waste of a young life, and what a sad thing to happen.An unfortunate sign of the times we live in. My sympathy Bruce.   Paul
I know EXACTLY how you feel as I have been there twice now and I don't want to do it again...............   vance
Happened minutes from my house, on trails I have walked hundreds of times. Sorry to hear u knew him bruce!
So very, very sad indeed! Another young life wasted for what?

First Bruce I must commend you on being a scout leader that is a very time consuming lifestyle but it is a big one in many kids lives and will help some make the right choices in there lives later on.  The news is very saddening to here of the loss of a youngone may he rest in pece.
If its the guy that was killed near Red Hill, I herd he was 21. Very sad indeed.
That was Dustin. He, his brother, and sister were scouting youth in 1st Beamsville.
It is very sad and i feel for your connection to him  Bruce . I think also of how hard it is in todays society to keep our young people safe .
Very sorry to hear. I despise senseless crimes that take the lives of innocent people. My condolences.
